Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the actions of Paul Ryan by stating that he "shut off the C-SPAN cameras" when in reality the cameras were shut off due to a recess declared by the presiding officer.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to prove that Paul Ryan intentionally shut off the cameras in response to the sit-in.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Paul Ryan was responsible for shutting off the cameras, without considering the role of the presiding officers and House rules.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the cameras were shut off, such as the recess declared by the presiding officer.
